17.summary:
The document outlines various discount programs available for diabetic supplies, physical therapy, and hearing aids. For diabetic supplies, customers can receive discounts ranging from 20% to 85% off retail prices. This includes brand name glucose test strips, glucose monitors, lancets, and other related devices. Additionally, discounts are available for blood pressure monitors and urinalysis test strips. Customer service and billing contact information is provided for further assistance.

In the realm of physical therapy and rehabilitation, the program offers an average savings of 20% at over 1,200 offices with 4,000 providers across 23 states. This benefit is designed to make rehabilitation and physical therapy more accessible and affordable for participants.

The hearing savings program provides free hearing consultations and exclusive discounts on the latest hearing aid technology. Participants can benefit from free annual hearing consultations at over 3,000 professional locations. The program also includes a free deluxe warranty and offers up to a 3-year supply of batteries, with 40 cells provided per hearing aid purchased each year. These programs are designed to offer significant savings and support for individuals requiring these specific health-related services.

18.summary:
The document outlines a program designed to assist members in reducing medical bills that exceed their allowed plan benefits. Patient advocates are available to negotiate on behalf of members to lower the costs of medical bills. A key requirement for this service is that the total bill must be at least $5000 to initiate negotiations. Full payment to the provider or facility is necessary once a negotiation is accepted. This program is not provided by AccessOne DMPO, emphasizing its role as a discount program rather than insurance.

Additionally, the document details a discount program for medical supplies and equipment. Members can save between 20% to 50% on various medical supply needs. The range of items includes ambulatory aids and bathroom safety products such as wheelchairs, scooters, and hospital beds. This program aims to provide significant savings on essential medical equipment, enhancing accessibility for members.

For further assistance or to access the program, members are directed to contact customer service or visit the specified website. The document provides contact numbers for customer service and billing inquiries, ensuring members have the necessary information to utilize these services effectively.

19.summary:
The Laboratory Savings Program provides an efficient, affordable, and confidential solution for medical laboratory testing. Members can access a wide array of medical laboratory tests, gain information on tests and diseases, and purchase lab tests directly from the website. This program is not available in New York, New Jersey, or Rhode Island. For assistance, customer service can be reached at 877-271-6559, and billing inquiries can be directed to 732-876-9733. More information and provider locations can be found at www.ncegapaffordplus.com.

SDO Nutrition offers support for achieving personal health goals, maintaining a healthy lifestyle, and managing chronic health conditions through food and diet education. The program provides services for weight loss, dietary restrictions, geriatric health, diabetes and high blood pressure management, chronic health conditions management, and nutrition for athletic and fitness training. Contact information is the same as the Laboratory Savings Program, with customer service at 877-271-6559 and billing at 732-876-9733. The website www.ncegapaffordplus.com provides access to the program and provider locations.

20.summary:
The document outlines two distinct services: speech therapy and a 24/7 nurse help line. The speech therapy service utilizes video conferencing technology to provide live, one-on-one, highly individualized, and interactive sessions. This telepractice model offers an alternative to traditional speech therapy, allowing clients to engage with therapists using therapeutic activities and exercises. Clients need a computer, high-speed internet, a web camera, and a quiet room to participate. Materials and follow-up resources are provided to help patients practice skills learned during sessions.

The 24/7 nurse help line offers access to registered nurses (RNs) who can answer questions on family health issues. This service is available in over 100 languages, providing medical information assistance around the clock. Both services emphasize accessibility and convenience, with customer service and billing contact information provided for further assistance. The document specifies that these programs are not provided by AccessOne DMPO and are part of a discount program.

21.summary:
The Chiropractic Savings Program provides members with a free initial consultation and offers up to 50% savings on diagnostic services and x-rays if necessary. Additionally, members can enjoy unlimited treatments with up to 30% savings through a national network of over 12,000 chiropractors. This program is designed to make chiropractic care more accessible and affordable for members. 

In addition to chiropractic savings, the program includes discounts on vitamins and supplements. Members can save up to 75% off retail pricing on a wide selection of natural products, including vitamins and supplements. This aspect of the program aims to support members in maintaining their overall health and wellness through affordable access to essential health products.

22.summary:
The Health Discount Program Member Agreement outlines the terms and conditions for participants in a Discount Medical Plan Organization provided by AccessOne Consumer Health, Inc. The agreement specifies that the plan is not insurance but offers discounts at certain healthcare providers for medical services. Members are responsible for paying for all healthcare services but can receive discounts from providers within the discount plan network. The document includes the effective date of enrollment, which is shown on the Member ID, and details the process for cancellation and complaint filing. 

Participants are required to pay any processing fees and periodic charges, with the option to change the mode of payment. The plan allows for the addition of dependent children at no extra charge. Members can cancel their participation within thirty days of enrollment to receive a full refund of any membership fees, minus a processing fee if applicable. After thirty days, cancellation is possible with a pro-rata refund for unused months. 

The agreement emphasizes that the plan is not intended to replace health insurance and does not meet minimum creditable coverage requirements under certain laws. It is not a Qualified Health Plan under the Affordable Care Act and is not a Medicare prescription drug plan. Members are encouraged to keep a copy of the agreement for their records, and they can access a list of participating providers online or by phone.

23.summary: This page provides information about a discount program offered by National Benefit Builders, Inc. It is important to note that this program is not an insurance plan but rather a discount program. The page is intended for agent use only, indicating that it contains details relevant to those selling or managing the program. The program is accredited by the Better Business Bureau, which may provide some assurance of its credibility and reliability. However, specific details about the benefits, coverage, or cost structures are not provided on this page. The page serves as a general introduction or cover page for the program, likely leading to more detailed sections elsewhere in the document.

1.summary: This document provides an overview of the insurance offerings by Everest Reinsurance Company, specifically focusing on the Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance plan. The plan is offered through NCE and utilizes the Multiplan PPO Network, providing a range of provider options for policyholders. The insurance type is designed to offer fixed indemnity benefits, which typically pay a set amount per day or per service, rather than covering a percentage of medical costs. This structure can be beneficial for individuals seeking predictable out-of-pocket expenses. The document highlights the carrier, Everest, known for its reinsurance capabilities, ensuring a robust backing for the insurance plans offered. The plan is tailored to meet the needs of individuals looking for specific coverage options within a network of providers, offering flexibility and choice. The use of the Multiplan PPO Network suggests a wide range of participating healthcare providers, enhancing accessibility for policyholders.

2.summary:
This page discusses the benefits of Group Indemnity Insurance, which provides fixed payments to help manage expenses arising from medical costs. It highlights how such insurance can supplement existing coverage to cover medical and living expenses. An example is provided where a 35-year-old woman incurs expenses after an accident, including a hospital admission benefit of $1,000, an ER admission benefit of $100, a hospital confinement benefit of $2,000, and a physician office benefit of $75, totaling $3,175. 

The document emphasizes the flexibility of using these benefits for various expenses such as medical copays, deductibles, transportation, child care, and housekeeping. It also outlines the advantages of choosing Everest Group Indemnity Insurance, including access to a Multiplan PPO Network, direct payment of benefits, and a fast, simplified claims process. 

The page notes that payouts are estimates and not guaranteed, with variations based on individual circumstances and plan offerings. It advises consulting policy documents for a complete description of benefits, exclusions, limitations, and conditions of coverage, as Everest products are limited benefit policies and not substitutes for major medical insurance.

3.summary:
The document provides detailed information on the Group Fixed Indemnity Plan, comparing Plan 100, Plan 200, Plan 200+, and Plan 300. Each plan offers different levels of benefits, with specific coverage amounts for hospital confinement, ICU confinement, and emergency room visits. For instance, Plan 100 provides $100 per day for hospital confinement and $100 for ICU confinement, while Plan 300 offers $300 per day for both. Emergency room benefits are consistent across all plans at $50 per visit.

Procedure benefits are available in Plan 200+ and Plan 300, with combined inpatient and outpatient surgery benefits capped at $250 per day. Outpatient benefits vary, with Plan 200+ offering coverage for lab tests, X-rays, and advanced diagnostics at $50 each, while Plan 300 does not cover these services. Physician's office visits are covered at $50 per visit across all plans, with varying limits on the number of visits per certificate year.

The plans include a pre-existing condition limitation, defined as a 12-12 pre-existing condition clause, meaning conditions treated or diagnosed within 12 months prior to the coverage effective date are excluded for the first 12 months of coverage. The underwriting level for all plans is guaranteed issue, ensuring coverage without medical underwriting. The document also notes that policy terms, conditions, and limitations may vary by state, and certain services like chiropractic and acupuncture are not covered.

4.summary:
The document provides detailed information on the Group Fixed Indemnity Plan, comparing four different plans: Plan 500, Plan 750, Plan 1000, and Plan 1000+. Each plan outlines specific benefits, coverage limits, and cost structures. The plans offer guaranteed issue underwriting with a pre-existing condition limitation of 12 months. Confinement benefits include hospital confinement and ICU confinement, with Plan 500 offering $500 for both, Plan 750 offering $750, and Plans 1000 and 1000+ offering $1000. Hospital benefits vary, with Plan 1000+ including a hospital admission benefit of $1000.

Procedure benefits cover surgery and anesthesia, with a maximum of three surgery days per certificate year shared between inpatient and outpatient services. Outpatient benefits include lab, X-rays, advanced diagnostics, and physician's office visits, with coverage amounts increasing from Plan 500 to Plan 1000+. For example, lab benefits range from $50 in Plan 500 to $100 in Plan 1000+. Emergency room benefits also vary, with Plan 500 covering $50 and Plan 1000+ covering $1000.

The document highlights specific limitations, such as the exclusion of chiropractic or acupuncture coverage and the absence of a cancellation age. Benefits are per person, and policy terms, conditions, exclusions, and limitations may vary by state. The coverage is subject to a pre-existing condition exclusion, which applies to medical treatment, diagnosis, care, or advice received during the 12 months prior to the effective date of coverage.

5.summary:
This document provides an overview of the Everest Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance, a supplemental health plan that offers fixed monetary benefits for specific covered medical expenses. It is also referred to as indemnity insurance or fee-for-service insurance. The document outlines where to find participating providers, directing members to a specific website or phone number for a list of providers offering plan discounts. Advanced Diagnostics covered under this plan include a range of tests such as Angiogram, CT Scan, MRI, and more.

The document clarifies terms like 'Calendar Year,' which spans from January 1st to December 31st, and 'Certificate Year,' which aligns with the Plan Year in the Certificate Schedule. A 'free look period' is available, allowing the Certificate Holder to return the Certificate within 10 days of receipt for any reason. 'Confinement' is defined as hospital admission for inpatient services, with benefits paid per day of confinement.

Diagnostic Care is described as any medically necessary procedure to diagnose a medical condition, including tests like X-rays and biopsies. The MultiPlan PPO Network is highlighted as a nationwide network providing additional provider choices with agreed service discounts.

6.summary:
This document outlines the exclusions and limitations associated with the insurance plan, specifying services, supplies, and treatments that are not considered covered. It details that expenses for certain services will not be payable unless otherwise stated. Specific exclusions include breast surgery, where benefits are not payable for capsular contraction, augmentation, or reduction mammoplasty, except for medically necessary reconstruction following a mastectomy due to cancer treatment. Cosmetic surgery is also excluded unless it is reconstructive and necessary due to trauma or disease.

Dental care is not covered except in cases of accidental injury to sound natural teeth within 12 months of a covered accident. Elective treatments and surgeries, as well as experimental or investigational treatments, are not payable. The document also excludes coverage for accidents resulting from participation in extreme sports, such as skydiving, bungee jumping, and mountaineering. Additionally, treatments received from family members or services incurred during foreign travel are not covered unless specific conditions are met, such as emergencies during business travel.

The document emphasizes that no benefits are payable for services provided by individuals who do not normally charge for their services, unless there is a legal obligation to pay. It also specifies that foreign travel coverage is limited to emergencies approved for use in the United States, with a restriction on coverage for trips exceeding 30 days.

7.summary:
This document outlines specific exclusions and limitations on coverage for various conditions and activities under the insurance plan. It specifies that no benefits are payable for treatments, services, or supplies related to gender-related conditions, including gender reassignment and treatments to enhance sexual energy or performance. Additionally, coverage is not provided for injuries received while engaging in hazardous occupations or activities, especially those involving compensation, such as professional sports or rodeo activities.

The plan excludes benefits for losses caused by illegal acts or while the covered person is incarcerated. Intoxication exclusions apply, with no benefits payable for losses occurring while the insured is deemed intoxicated, as determined by legal blood alcohol levels. Similarly, no benefits are provided for treatments deemed not medically necessary.

Mental illness and substance abuse treatments are generally excluded, except as specified under certain benefit provisions. Narcotic exclusions apply unless the substance is prescribed by a physician. Overdose-related medical conditions are not covered unless treatment is administered under medical advice. Pregnancy-related treatments are excluded, except in life-threatening situations for the mother. Lastly, no benefits are payable for losses incurred while participating in military actions or supporting such forces.

8.summary:
This document outlines specific exclusions and limitations associated with the insurance plan. It details that no benefits are payable for manipulations of the musculoskeletal system or acupuncture, particularly when related to nerve interference or subluxation of the vertebral column. Sports-related injuries, especially those from intercollegiate, interscholastic, or professional athletics, are not covered, although local community sports activities are excluded from this limitation.

The plan also excludes coverage for losses caused by suicide or intentional injury, even if the act was unintended. Accidents involving unlicensed drivers are not covered unless the driver holds a valid learner's permit and is under instruction. Losses due to war, riots, or insurrections, as well as acts of terrorism, are not covered unless the insured was a victim of the act.

Weight-related treatments, including surgeries and programs for weight reduction, are not covered. This includes any medical or surgical interventions aimed at controlling weight, as well as associated memberships or nutritional counseling. Workers' compensation-related conditions are also excluded from coverage.

Pre-existing conditions are not covered for a period of 12 months, as specified in the schedule of benefits, unless the condition pertains to a newborn or adopted child. Additionally, a waiting period must be completed before certain benefits become payable, with specific provisions for newborn or adopted children. The waiting period is defined as the time from the effective date of coverage during which no benefits are payable.

9.summary:
The Discount Benefit Program Member Handbook provides an overview of the benefits available to members, emphasizing the inclusion of limited medical benefits alongside valuable discount opportunities. This program is designed to supplement existing medical coverage by offering additional savings on various services. Members can access a range of discounts that enhance their healthcare experience, making it more affordable and accessible. The handbook highlights the importance of these benefits in providing financial relief and support for everyday medical needs.

In addition to the limited medical benefits, the program offers a variety of discount options that members can utilize. These discounts are applicable to a wide array of services, ensuring that members can find savings in multiple areas of their healthcare journey. The handbook serves as a guide to understanding how these benefits can be integrated into one's healthcare plan, providing a strategic advantage in managing medical expenses. It is important to note that this program is not insurance but a discount program designed to complement existing coverage.

10.summary:
This document serves as the table of contents for a health discount program, outlining various services and savings opportunities available to members. The program includes a range of benefits such as dental and vision services, pharmacy discounts, and brand-name mail-order options. Additionally, members can access savings on CBD products, diabetic supplies, and physical therapy and rehabilitation services. The program also offers a hearing savings program and medical bill negotiation services to assist members in managing healthcare costs. 

Further benefits include access to medical supplies and equipment, laboratory savings programs, and nutrition services. Speech therapy and a 24/7 nurse help line are also available, providing support and guidance for members. The chiropractic savings plan and discounts on vitamins and supplements offer additional health and wellness benefits. Finally, the document includes a health discount program member agreement, detailing the terms and conditions of membership.

11.summary:
The GapAfford Plus program is designed to help individuals and families save on out-of-pocket medical expenses, regardless of their current insurance status. It offers savings from the first dollar spent, with no limits, providing access to pre-negotiated rates similar to those received by insurance companies. This program is particularly beneficial for those with high deductible health plans, no insurance, or those who are under-insured. It also caters to individuals who cannot get insurance due to pre-existing conditions or those whose plans do not cover certain procedures. Additionally, it is suitable for people in their eligibility waiting period or those on COBRA. Notably, everyone is approved without the need for a medical exam.

The program does not include deductibles, pre-existing condition limitations, medical exams, claim forms, usage limitations, or age restrictions, except for work already in progress. All household members are included, regardless of age, and students away at college are also covered. It is important to note that this is not an insurance plan but a reduced fee-for-service program. Participants must pay for services at the time they are rendered, and discounts are available when using participating providers. The program does not meet the requirements of the PPACA and is not available in certain states, including Alaska, Montana, Rhode Island, Utah, Vermont, and Washington.

12.summary:
The document outlines the benefits of the Aetna Dental Access Network, part of the GapAfford Plus program, which provides access to a vast network of over 262,000 dental practice locations across the United States. Members can enjoy savings ranging from 15-50% on various dental services, including cleanings, x-rays, fillings, root canals, crowns, bridges, and orthodontia. The program highlights several advantages, such as no waiting periods, no age restrictions, and no pre-existing condition exclusions, except for ongoing work. There are no benefit maximums, and members do not need to deal with paperwork or claim forms. Cosmetic dentistry and orthodontia are included, and the program can be used alongside existing dental insurance. Vision discounts are also available.

The document includes a sample dental care savings table, comparing the regional average costs by Aetna with the costs under the Dentachoice program. For example, a periodic oral exam costs $73 on average, but with Dentachoice, it is reduced to $35, resulting in a total saving of $38. Similarly, a comprehensive oral exam costs $113 on average, reduced to $49 with Dentachoice, saving $64. The table provides detailed cost comparisons for various procedures, including x-rays, cleanings, fillings, crowns, and root canals, demonstrating significant savings for members.

The program is not available in certain states, including Alaska, Montana, Rhode Island, Utah, Vermont, and Washington. It is important to note that this is a discount program and not insurance. Prices can change without notice, and actual costs and savings may vary by provider and location. The program is administered by Aetna Life Insurance Company, but Aetna does not provide dental care and is not responsible for outcomes.

13.summary:
The OUTLOOK Vision network offers access to over 12,000 eye care locations nationwide, including ophthalmologists, optometrists, and optical centers. The vision program provides significant savings on prescription eyeglasses, frames, and lenses, with discounts ranging from 10% to 50% at participating locations. Additionally, there are savings on contact lenses, excluding disposables, and discounts of 10% to 30% on medical eye exams and surgical procedures like PRK and LASIK, where available and approved.

Sample vision care savings are illustrated with specific examples from various locations. For instance, at Exact Eye Care in Kearney, NE, a frame single vision with polycarbonate is available at a retail price of $129.00, with a member price of $90.30, resulting in a 30% savings. Similar savings are detailed for other locations and items, such as LensCrafters in Mesa, AZ, and JC Penney in Michigan.

The document also lists some participating vision care providers, including Pearle Vision, Sears Optical, and J.C. Penney Optical, among others. This extensive network ensures that members have access to a wide range of services and providers across the country.

14.summary:
The pharmacy discount card offers significant savings on medications, allowing users to save an average of 55% on generic drugs and 15% on brand-name drugs. This card is accepted at over 80% of pharmacies across the United States, providing a wide national network for users. All FDA-approved drugs, including lifestyle medications, are available at reduced rates. There is no limit on the number of prescriptions that can be filled using this card, and it includes coverage for pet medications as well.

The card is pre-activated and never expires, allowing immediate use without the need for activation or filling out forms. It covers the entire household with no exclusions, ensuring that all family members can benefit from the discounts. Importantly, personal information is never collected from the card user, maintaining privacy and security.

To utilize the card, members simply present their member ID card to the pharmacist along with their prescription. This program is not insurance but a discount program, providing a cost-effective solution for prescription needs.

15.summary:
The RX Mail-Order program by MedAfford Global offers significant savings on prescription medications, with potential discounts of up to 80% on brand-name and generic drugs. Insulin medications can be obtained with savings of 45% or more. The process is designed to be convenient, easy, and secure, allowing customers to order medications online or via phone. To begin, customers can price their medications on the MedAfford Global website or by calling the provided number. A valid prescription from a doctor is required to complete the order. Once ordered, medications are shipped directly to the customer, with email confirmation provided.

The document includes a list of commonly ordered brand-name medications with their average prices based on a 90-day supply. For example, Abilify 10mg is priced at $160, Advair Diskus 50/250mcg 180 doses at $144, and Eliquis 5mg 180 tabs at $236. Generic medications are also listed, such as Amlodipine 10mg for $20 and Lisinopril 20mg for $22. These prices do not include a $4.95 shipping fee or the cost of insurance for shipment. The program is administered by National Benefit Builders, Inc., and it is important to note that this is a discount program, not insurance.

16.summary:
This page introduces the benefits of incorporating CBD into daily health routines, emphasizing its natural ingredients and the purest form of Cannabidiol. It highlights CBD as a safe and effective alternative to prescription painkillers for individuals, families, and pets. The document explains that CBD, or cannabidiol, is a compound found in hemp plants, known for supporting peace and balance without intoxication. It reassures users that CBD can be added to daily routines without altering the state of mind. The page also discusses the selection of vendors by CBD Afford, focusing on those offering healthier, plant-based relief options.

The document outlines the unique aspects of their CBD products, including compliance with the Farm Bill Act of 2018 and the use of high-quality, pharmacist-formulated full-spectrum CBD products. It emphasizes the purity and potency of ingredients, supported by multi-stage third-party lab testing. Additionally, each package includes QR codes linked to lab results, ensuring transparency and quality assurance for consumers.

presentation.content:
**Cover (1 slide)**
- **Plan Name:** Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance
- **Tagline:** "Predictable Coverage, Flexible Choices"

**Plan Overview (1 slide)**
- **Target Audience:** Individuals and families seeking predictable out-of-pocket expenses.
- **Offerings:** Healthcare coverage with fixed indemnity benefits.
- **Key Benefits:** Accessibility through the Multiplan PPO Network, flexibility in provider choice, and predictable expenses.

**Core Plan Elements (2-3 slides)**
- **Coverage Areas:** Physician services, hospitalization, virtual visits.
- **Plan Structure:** Tiered options with fixed payments, co-pays, and visit limits.
- **Eligibility:** Open to individuals and families, with a focus on affordability.

**Common Service Features (2-3 slides)**
- **Provider Networks:** Access to a wide range of healthcare providers through the Multiplan PPO Network.
- **Claims Management:** Direct payment of benefits with a fast, simplified claims process.
- **Support Tools:** Wellness programs, advocacy services, and online dashboards for easy management.

**Plan Tiers Breakdown (8-12 slides)**

- **Plan 100**
  - **Benefits:**
    - Hospital Confinement: $100 per day
    - ICU Confinement: $200 per day
    - Emergency Room: $50 per visit
    - Physician's Office: $50 per visit, 3 visits per year
  - **Structure:** 12-12 pre-existing condition limitation, guaranteed issue underwriting.

- **Plan 200**
  - **Benefits:**
    - Hospital Confinement: $200 per day
    - ICU Confinement: $200 per day
    - Emergency Room: $50 per visit
    - Physician's Office: $50 per visit, 3 visits per year
    - Lab and X-Rays: $50 per service
  - **Structure:** 12-12 pre-existing condition limitation, guaranteed issue underwriting.

- **Plan 200+**
  - **Benefits:**
    - Hospital Confinement: $200 per day
    - ICU Confinement: $200 per day
    - Emergency Room: $50 per visit
    - Physician's Office: $50 per visit, 3 visits per year
    - Lab and X-Rays: $50 per service
    - Surgery: $250 per day, 3 days per year
  - **Structure:** 12-12 pre-existing condition limitation, guaranteed issue underwriting.

- **Plan 300**
  - **Benefits:**
    - Hospital Confinement: $300 per day
    - ICU Confinement: $300 per day
    - Emergency Room: $50 per visit
    - Physician's Office: $50 per visit, 3 visits per year
  - **Structure:** 12-12 pre-existing condition limitation, guaranteed issue underwriting.

- **Plan 500**
  - **Benefits:**
    - Hospital Confinement: $500 per day
    - ICU Confinement: $500 per day
    - Emergency Room: $50 per visit
    - Physician's Office: $50 per visit, 5 visits per year
    - Lab and X-Rays: $50 per service
    - Surgery: $350 per day, 3 days per year
  - **Structure:** 12-12 pre-existing condition limitation, guaranteed issue underwriting.

- **Plan 750**
  - **Benefits:**
    - Hospital Confinement: $750 per day
    - ICU Confinement: $750 per day
    - Emergency Room: $75 per visit
    - Physician's Office: $50 per visit, 5 visits per year
    - Lab and X-Rays: $50 per service
    - Surgery: $400 per day, 3 days per year
  - **Structure:** 12-12 pre-existing condition limitation, guaranteed issue underwriting.

- **Plan 1000**
  - **Benefits:**
    - Hospital Confinement: $1000 per day
    - ICU Confinement: $1000 per day
    - Emergency Room: $100 per visit
    - Physician's Office: $75 per visit, 5 visits per year
    - Lab and X-Rays: $75 per service
    - Surgery: $500 per day, 3 days per year
  - **Structure:** 12-12 pre-existing condition limitation, guaranteed issue underwriting.

- **Plan 1000+**
  - **Benefits:**
    - Hospital Confinement: $1000 per day
    - ICU Confinement: $1000 per day
    - Emergency Room: $100 per visit
    - Hospital Admission: $1000
    - Physician's Office: $75 per visit, 5 visits per year
    - Lab and X-Rays: $100 per service
    - Surgery: $500 per day, 3 days per year
  - **Structure:** 12-12 pre-existing condition limitation, guaranteed issue underwriting.

**Comparison Slides (Markdown Table)**

| Feature                  | Plan 100 | Plan 200 | Plan 200+ | Plan 300 | Plan 500 | Plan 750 | Plan 1000 | Plan 1000+ |
|--------------------------|----------|----------|-----------|----------|----------|----------|-----------|------------|
| Hospital Confinement     | $100     | $200     | $200      | $300     | $500     | $750     | $1000     | $1000      |
| ICU Confinement          | $200     | $200     | $200      | $300     | $500     | $750     | $1000     | $1000      |
| Emergency Room           | $50      | $50      | $50       | $50      | $50      | $75      | $100      | $100       |
| Physician's Office       | $50      | $50      | $50       | $50      | $50      | $50      | $75       | $75        |
| Lab and X-Rays           | N/A      | $50      | $50       | N/A      | $50      | $50      | $75       | $100       |
| Surgery                  | N/A      | N/A      | $250      | $250     | $350     | $400     | $500      | $500       |
| Hospital Admission       | N/A      | N/A      | N/A       | N/A      | N/A      | N/A      | N/A       | $1000      |

**Limitations and Exclusions (1-2 slides)**
- **Exclusions:** Pre-existing conditions (12-month exclusion), cosmetic surgery, dental care (except accidental injury), experimental treatments, extreme sports injuries, and more.
- **Limitations:** Waiting periods, specific service exclusions, and state-specific policy variations.

**Key Takeaways and Action Steps (1 slide)**
- **Flexibility:** Multiple plan tiers to suit different needs and budgets.
- **Balance:** Offers a balance between cost and coverage with predictable expenses.
- **Next Steps:** Contact a representative for enrollment details and support.

**Thank You (1 slide)**
- **Message:** "Thank you for considering Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance. We look forward to serving your healthcare needs."

slides.content:

script.content:
---- Cover ----

Hello, everyone! Thank you for joining today's session on the Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance. We'll walk through this plan's features and benefits, designed to provide predictable coverage with flexible choices. Let's get started!

---- Everest Reinsurance Group Overview ----

The Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance is offered through NCE. 

This plan provides fixed indemnity benefits, which means you receive a set payment amount for covered services, ensuring predictable expenses. 

With access to the Multiplan PPO Network, you have a wide range of provider options. 

Everest's reinsurance capabilities enhance the plan's reliability. 

Flexible coverage options are available to suit your needs.

Now, let's explore the key features and benefits.

---- Key Features and Benefits ----

This plan offers fixed payments, providing financial predictability. 

It serves as supplemental coverage, complementing other insurance you may have. 

The wide provider network ensures you have access to numerous healthcare professionals. 

Direct payment of benefits varies by plan, offering convenience. 

The fast claims process through Multiplan ensures quick resolution.

Let's move on to cost management tools.

---- Cost Management Tools ----

The Multiplan PPO Network, or MPN, is a key component of cost management. 

The direct payment system simplifies transactions. 

Simplified claims support makes managing your benefits straightforward.

Next, we'll discuss how the Multiplan PPO Network works.

---- How Multiplan PPO Network Works ----

To begin, enroll through NCE. 

You'll have access to a wide range of providers within the network. 

Utilize fixed indemnity benefits for covered services. 

You'll receive an Explanation of Benefits, or EOB, detailing your coverage. 

Manage your out-of-pocket expenses with predictable costs.

Now, let's look at preventive care and wellness.

---- Preventive Care and Wellness ----

Routine checkups are part of the services offered. 

Wellness programs provide additional health support. 

Multiplan ensures network access for these services.

Let's explore telehealth services next.

---- Telehealth Services ----

You have twenty-four/seven access to healthcare professionals. 

Virtual consultations offer convenience and flexibility. 

Remote monitoring is available for ongoing care. 

This provides convenient access to necessary care.

Now, let's discuss advocacy and support services.

---- Advocacy and Support Services ----

Personalized healthcare advocacy is available to assist you. 

Claims assistance support helps navigate the claims process. 

Benefit options guidance ensures you understand your choices. 

Member support services are there to help with any questions.

Let's examine the details of Plan 100, Plan 200, and Plan 300.

---- Plan 100, Plan 200, Plan 300 (One of Two) ----

Confinement benefits include thirty days per confinement and ninety days per certificate year, with guaranteed issue underwriting. 

Hospital confinement benefits are one hundred dollars for Plan 100, two hundred dollars for Plan 200, and three hundred dollars for Plan 300. 

ICU confinement benefits are two hundred dollars for Plan 100 and Plan 200, and three hundred dollars for Plan 300.

Continuing with these plans, let's look at outpatient benefits.

---- Plan 100, Plan 200, Plan 300 (Two of Two) ----

Emergency room visits are covered at fifty dollars per visit, with two visits per certificate year. 

Outpatient benefits include physician's office visits at fifty dollars per visit, and X-rays and labs at fifty dollars per service.

Now, let's explore Plan 500, Plan 750, Plan 1000, and Plan 1000+.

---- Plan 500, Plan 750, Plan 1000, Plan 1000+ (One of Two) ----

Confinement benefits remain consistent with thirty days per confinement and ninety days per certificate year, with guaranteed issue underwriting. 

Hospital confinement benefits are five hundred dollars for Plan 500, seven hundred fifty dollars for Plan 750, and one thousand dollars for Plan 1000 and Plan 1000+. 

ICU confinement benefits match the hospital confinement amounts for each plan.

Let's continue with the emergency room and outpatient benefits.

---- Plan 500, Plan 750, Plan 1000, Plan 1000+ (Two of Two) ----

Emergency room benefits are fifty dollars for Plan 500, seventy-five dollars for Plan 750, and one hundred dollars for Plan 1000 and Plan 1000+. 

Outpatient benefits include lab and X-ray services ranging from fifty to one hundred dollars, and advanced diagnostic services also ranging from fifty to one hundred dollars.

Now, let's compare the plans.

---- Comparing the Plans ----

Here is a comparison of the plans. 

Hospital confinement benefits range from one hundred dollars in Plan 100 to one thousand dollars in Plan 1000 and Plan 1000+. 

ICU confinement benefits are consistent with hospital confinement amounts. 

Emergency room coverage starts at fifty dollars and increases to one hundred dollars in higher tiers. 

Surgery benefits are available in Plan 300 and above, with varying daily amounts.

Let's review definitions and limitations.

---- Definitions and Limitations ----

Pre-existing conditions are subject to a twelve-twelve clause, excluding coverage for the first twelve months, but guaranteed issue is available. 

Exclusions include cosmetic surgery and dental care, except for injury-related treatments. 

Limitations apply to services like chiropractic and acupuncture, as well as experimental treatments. 

Coverage variations may occur due to state-specific terms, but there is no cancellation age.

Finally, let's summarize the key takeaways and reminders.

---- Key Takeaways and Reminders ----

The plan offers fixed indemnity benefits for predictable expenses. 

A wide network is included for extensive provider access. 

Predictable costs help manage your healthcare budget. 

Enrollment is required to take advantage of these benefits.

---- Closing ----

Thank you for participating in the Everest Reinsurance Group Fixed Indemnity Insurance Review. We look forward to serving your healthcare needs. Continue to be great!

Exclusions include cosmetic surgery and dental care, except for injury-related treatments. 

Limitations apply to services like chiropractic and acupuncture, as well as experimental treatments. 

Coverage variations may occur due to state-specific terms, but there is no cancellation age.

Finally, let's summarize the key takeaways and reminders.

slide.content:
## Key Takeaways and Reminders

script.content:
The plan offers fixed indemnity benefits for predictable expenses. 

A wide network is included for extensive provider access. 

Predictable costs help manage your healthcare budget. 

Enrollment is required to take advantage of these benefits.
